com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceAnnotators

Class AbstractRegexAnnotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceAnnotators.AbstractRegexAnnotator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotator<Sentence>, RegexAnnotator, SentenceAnnotator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RegexAttributeAnnotator, RegexTokenAnnotator

    public abstract class AbstractRegexAnnotator
extends java.lang.Object
implements RegexAnnotator
    A parent class for RegexAnnotator implementations, which knows how to construct the Pattern using the various attributes set and the initial regex, and how to apply the regex to get the matching placeholders.

    The following parameters are recognised:
    • group: see RegexAnnotator.getGroupIndex()
    • caseSensitive: see RegexAnnotator.isCaseSensitive()
    • diacriticSensitive: see RegexAnnotator.isDiacriticSensitive()
    • autoWordBoundaries: see RegexAnnotator.isAutoWordBoundaries()


    Any additional unrecognised parameters are assumed to be token attributes.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
      If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}.

      • AbstractRegexAnnotator

        public AbstractRegexAnnotator(java.lang.String descriptor,

                              java.util.Set<java.lang.String> handledParameters,
                              boolean singleToken,
                              TalismaneSession session)
                       throws SentenceAnnotatorLoadException
        A constructor used when automatically generating annotator from descriptors.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the full descriptor used to construct the annotator
        handledParameters - any parameters handled by the sub-class - any additional parameters are either handled here, or added as token attributes
        singleToken - whether this annotator identifies a single token's boundaries
        session - the current talismane session
        Throws:
        SentenceAnnotatorLoadException

      • isDiacriticSensitive

        public boolean isDiacriticSensitive()
        Description copied from interface: RegexAnnotator
        If false, will replace any adorned letter with a class containing both unadorned and adorned versions. Default is true.
        Specified by:
        isDiacriticSensitive in interface RegexAnnotator

      • isCaseSensitive

        public boolean isCaseSensitive()
        Description copied from interface: RegexAnnotator
        If false, will replace any letter by a class containing the uppercase and lowercase versions of the letter. If the letter has a diacritic, both the unadorned and adorned uppercase versions will be included. Default is true.
        Specified by:
        isCaseSensitive in interface RegexAnnotator

      • isAutoWordBoundaries

        public boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
        Description copied from interface: RegexAnnotator
        If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}. Note that a + at the end of the regex is ignored, but a * or ? is not (as it doesn't guarantee that the class will be matched). Default is false.
        Specified by:
        isAutoWordBoundaries in interface RegexAnnotator

      • isExcluded

        public boolean isExcluded()
        Description copied from interface: SentenceAnnotator
        Returns true if this SentenceAnnotator should be excluded from the list of annotators for the current configuration. This will typically be set during the load method, based on context specific considerations.
        Specified by:
        isExcluded in interface SentenceAnnotator
